no thank you  ""
normal idaho doesn't want them either  ""
every time we drive in oregon  we marvel at the road quality and how nice their rest stops are  ""
i hope they do join idaho so they  too  can enjoy crumbling roads  terrifying healthcare restrictions  and school facilities that are falling apart  ""
the change has to be agreed on by both states  they can get his support  it means nothing  trump can't force a state to cede land  oregon doesn't agree  end of discussion  ""
gross  ""
if they don't like it why don't they just move  ""
more fleecing the rubes  good luck  ""
let s spend a bunch of money  for no reason ""
the  greater oregon movement  https   greateroregon org   has not asked trump for his support  ""
lol no ""
this would ruin idaho  as a native born from pocatello and a current oregon resident   the  conservatives  here are hippies compared to idaho  ""
not gonna happen ffs  ""

i think one of the things that makes me mad about this the most is you know these people petitioning for this are the same people who will tell you  if you don t love it then leave it   or change the borders i guess ""
i really don t like the shape of that new state  not appealing at all  plus all those hats and stickers of idaho shooting pine trees would become redundant  lol ""
greater idaho is such a dumb grift ""
it's only a matter of time until republicans start gerrymandering entire states  ""
deleted  ""
too late  this proposal has been a thing for years  your friends who voted for trump also want state s rights  ""
is that a thing they exists   ""
there's a  normal idaho   ""
damn straight ""
idahoans love the shape of idaho too much to make it stop looking like a gun  ""
sure  but he could order the military to invade the oregon state capitol and jail the governor and legislators until they  agree  to cede their land ""
no no no  only conservatives are allowed to tell people that  otherwise it's cancel culture or silencing dissent  or an echo chamber or something  ""
ouch  ""
wait a minute    spokane here   there are good people here  ""
idaho could just take an idaho shaped chunk sticking out that makes it look like their gun is carrying a gun  ""
that chunk of mountain time in oregon could be the scope of the idaho 30 06 ""
what would it look like with poverty stricken eastern oregon and all its drug problems  ""
idaho has sent oregon a formal request to begin negotiations for the transfer of land  idaho  at least the government  comes out better for this deal  ""
he can't legally do that  and while we all know he doesn't abide by the law  the military does  ""

my biggest drug problem in eastern oregon is that i have to drive all the way to eastern oregon to get my drugs  let s give some of idaho s land to oregon so we can live a little closer to the border and i can buy my stash in nampa  ""
idaho can't afford to maintain its own infrastructure  how will it maintain more  ""

no they haven't because that's not how that works  several parties including the federal government have to approve it  any  formal negotiations  is entirely just political grandstanding to make it look like they're doing something other than losing lawsuits  ""
why would idaho want to babysit oregon's shitholes  ""
we have plenty of those in this state already  ""

based on what i have seen and heard  no they don t  the cost for land alone is huge  on top of that  those areas are relatively poorer  so idaho would have to pay more in aid  couple that with those areas loosing money from weed shops and other income would make it a truly idiotic move to agree  ""
i also don t think the idiots in oregon have thought of this  they would have no weed  they would have a far lower minimum wage  and taxes would have to be paid on all items  ""
idaho  at least the government  comes out better for this deal  ""
except they very much don't  ""
all the land they'd have to buy  more tax burden  and a population tax base in the neighborhood of meridian would be a massive loss for idaho  ""
the military does ""

maybe most of the folks currently serving wouldn't agree to such drastic action  but it won't be all that hard for the commander in chief to simply replace those people with sycophants who will do literally anything he asks ""
this is a great idea   i don't even smoke  but i agree  ""

the border changes must be agreed upon by both states' legislators and be approved by congress  the first step is that the states involved must agree  that requires a negotiation  one that idaho  has already started  https   idahocapitalsun com 2023 02 01 idaho legislators push for discussions about moving the states border with oregon    ""
but oregon won't agree to the border change  read the whole thread  friend  i made this clear already  ""
ask your legislators  ""
https   idahocapitalsun com 2023 02 01 idaho legislators push for discussions about moving the states border with oregon  ""
everyone in those regions would be cheering right up until their ohp  oregon medicaid  got cancelled and they had to deal with idaho insurance  ""
you are incorrect  ""
https   idahocapitalsun com 2023 02 01 idaho legislators push for discussions about moving the states border with oregon  ""
i believe the absolute worst of donald trump  but i'll give you  1000 dollars if he can either a  describe this issue or b  care enough to spend that much political capital  ""
he'd totally do it  but there's not enough bribery  attractive women  or autocrats to impress to make this happen  ""
you morons downvoting me are in for a nasty surprise the next four years ""
that's two members out of 70 trying to get our legislature to even talk about it seriously and was from almost two years ago without anything more mentioned since then  ""
a few hours later  what do you mean ohp was something oregon did for me  i thought that was from trump   ""

his whole political career has demonstrated that he has literally unlimited political capital  he can say or do pretty much whatever he wants without affecting public opinion of himself  as he said  he could shoot someone in broad daylight and not lose any votes ""

he didn't know what he was doing during his first term and brought it normie republicans almost all of whom he fired sooner or later  now he knows how the system works and there's every reason to believe that he and the self interested sycophants surrounding him will use the full authority of the office of potus to accomplish their goals by any means  legal or illegal ""

my entire family was killed by a brain eating amoeba that they got from the exact same hot springs you were at  at the same time     ""
it's probably best to get your affairs in order  ""
afaik the brain eating amoeba needs to get  up your nose  in order to get to your brain and chow down  so if you re legit concerned  just don t submerge your head ""
don't know but please keep us posted  preferably before the brain eating commences   ""
you more need to worry about those little red spiders following you home  ""
makes sense to me     every morning on my commute to work there is at least one accident and every evening on my return there is at least one accident    now i know why  100  will not hot spring  ""

the biggest thing i have learned from hot springs is they are totally safe if the water doesnt enter any open cuts or open body parts  dont dunk your head under water keep it out of your mouth eyes ears nose and any open cuts and you should be fine   ""

there was a case of two people hanging out in a hot spring in idaho  i believe but could be mistaken   long story short a couple went to the hot spring next day guy woke up with a severe black eye  woke up the next day it was worse and he was loosing vision  went to the doctor  none of the doctors there could figure it out  called cdc still no answers  one doctor got back from vacation took a look at him and asked have u been in a hot tub  guy said no but i was in a hot spring doc said that was the issue or cause  if you want to look it up it was in the meat eater camp fire stories and close calls  the first book  ""
we had that here in jackson  so just over the hill from idaho  don t ever down in these springs mostly bc you re bathing in bison shit  ""
https   www jhnewsandguide com news environmental kelly spring contains brain eating amoeba article 387c2f50 bdff 5360 96f3 d1e69b11c060 html ""
i've never heard of brain eating amoeba's in idaho ""
every time i have read about deaths from that it was in the deep south in the summer when sections of the rivers or a pond get lukewarm  i don t think most amoebas like heat  just tepid water  ""
it is real  its one of the many reasons they occasionally close hot springs and water areas like lucky peak  ""

i've heard the same thing happening to others     those hot springs are warm and moist growing ponds for all kinds of stuff  who knows  maybe the next covid will come out of one of them here next time   ""
if not that  maybe you might get attacked by a bear too so stay clear of all of them   ""
please remember this phrase that is burned into is locals while we are young   don't go chasing hot springs  please stick to the rivers and the lakes that you're use too   ""

also me personally  i refuse them in the name of public safety  there's no life guard as well  what is gonna happen if you ate in the middle of one of them and you get a leg cramp      better have your will ready  i'm just saying      ""
if i start feeling symptoms i ll let you know if i remember  ""

fair enough  i looked it up too and couldn t find really anything on it too much   a few things but some of them weren t even based in idaho   i m pretty convinced it s not in the hot spring water but you never know  ""

i've been in a lot of hot springs in california and nevada  been following the amoeba thing for decades   i've had red mite bites  and they sucked  like bad mosquito bites that get infected  but at least one hot spring i used  deep creek  does have the amoeba  so yes  it is possible to encounter it  just assume it is there and stay above the water  or at least don't dive down into the gross parts of the spring  ""
what do you mean by accident  like car accident  ""
i thought the lucky peak closures were for e  coli   · »  ""
i wouldn't worry about it too much  if there was an outbreak at any hot spring in idaho  the state would send out a team to stomp it out immediately  ""
hot springs are like mountain vistas  trout  mountain goats  and rushing rivers in idaho  they all represent good press and tourist dollars  don't mess with the formula  ""
probably shouldn't drink the hot spring water    ""

this isnt true at all there are parasites in every body of water  the only time the state intervenes is if its an invasive species such as muscles that tear up irrigation equipment and fresh water equipment  water treatment facilities   ""

in order for a fish to live in any body of water there has to be an eco system  fish breath air from the water so the ph of the water must be within reason for those fish to eat they must have a food source parasites in the water  algea  other smaller fish  now amoebas arent really a benefit to a biosystem however they are still there naturally   ""
you are correct about the tourist dollars however that plays no part in the state making any body of water parasite or amoeba free  ""

if highly recommend non lds counseling    so much lds stuff is ridiculous guilt and shaming over normal human thoughts and activities  it's not healthy for either side  ""
you'll get better advice from an lsd counselor than any lds  ""
the book why does he do that  by lundy bancroft helped me a lot more than couple's counseling did  and even helped me to better understand why my ex and i weren't having success with counseling  ""

i wish i had a good counselor to recommend  even though i didn't have any luck  i still think it's worth trying  i hope someone else here has a good suggestion  and that you guys are able to work things out  good luck  ""
cherity woolf in idaho falls  cannot recommend  her high enough  ""

i also recommend that both of you do individual counseling  and if your spouse is not willing to do individual counseling that you start that for yourself  it's a big time commitment but if you're both committed to the growth that you need  individual and couples counseling can be a great combination  ""
idaho is part of psypact   you can access telehealth services from therapists in any psypact state https   psypact gov mpage psypactmap ""
the gottman institute https   www gottman com  is an excellent resource for information and a list of gottman trained couple's therapists   ""
you can also find therapists using apa search tool https   www psychologytoday com us therapists search idaho ""
check out the emotion focused therapy resources here https   www eftresourcecenter com emotionally focused therapy eft ""
why does he do that  by lundy bancroft is available for free as a pdf https   www docdroid net 2fzmz40 why does he do that pdf ""
natasha helfer s website might be a good resource even though they are in utah  remote options or local recommendations   ""
https   www natashahelfer com  ""

greenstone counseling in rexburg  i believe they may have now opened an office in if  exmo  therapist s husband brady nordfelt has been on a podcast  maybe ms · »   used to work for byu i but both are now out  ""
edit punctuation ""
edit  found podcast  rameumpton  rumination s  096 ""

i would recommend a therapist who is well versed in john gottman's principles  since you mention being lds  in my experience  there is a lot of cultural baggage you're both carrying around in marriage that can make it difficult to cut through to fix the root of your problems  if you go into an lds therapist expecting them to help you fix your marriage to match the expectations of lds culture  and part of your problems are that neither of you is good at the cultural expectations  or one of you enjoys the benefits of cultural expectations while the other suffers through it   you're never going to fix the problem  and then  because i know you're nervous about the backlash of asking  i am active lds and have been married for over two decades  you're welcome to private message me if you'd like  ""
you can look for a gottman trained therapist here   https   gottmanreferralnetwork com   https   gottmanreferralnetwork com   ""

avoid going to an lds counselor  i have experience with both an lds counselor and a non lds counselor and it was very very different experiences and was helped so much more by the non lds counselor  ""
i would suggest a male counselor  make sure the bias isn't going one way or another  ""
thanks a ton ""

come see us up at schweitzer  even if you don't ski snowboard  the views are great  when it's not foggy   and it's just a fun vibe atmosphere  ""
tons of hikes and outdoors stuff to do year 'round all over the area  ""
almost all local breweries are great  especially the one next to panhandle pies  ""
hoot owl cafe has the best small town atmosphere and home style cooking  bring a large appetite  ""
and schweitzer ski resort is lovely  ""
sandpoint in all is still getting updated to be current for modern standards  but a lovely place  don't speed in most areas  sandpoint cops are very sneaky  ""
the bay trail is a nice walk along the lake when it gets warm again   find a friend with a boat and get a paddle board  great to be on the lake in the summer ""
selkirk loop  canada is your next door neighbor now  ""
sandpoint is a pretty small town  most fun activities are outdoors   hiking  going to the beach  etc  ""
kinda funny people are pointing out drinking as a fun activity     lmaooooo ""

it depends a lot on what your interests are  we have great live music and our bars are fun  every summer  we have a huge pride festival  in addition to skiing  schweitzer has great events year round  ""
i hope you have living arrangements worked out  rental market is rough up here   ""
if you haven't already  you might want to check out  https   visitsandpoint com   https   visitsandpoint com   ""
their calendar is comprehensive  ""
floating the pack river is a lot of fun in the summer  ""
the nice part about that lake is it s huge  meaning you can find swimming spots all to yourself   ""
in the winter there is schweitzer and snowmobiling on both sides of the valley  ""
weekends with having live music at 7 10 venues is awesome  there is some really good local and regional talent   ""
sandpoint online and the reader will give you a good idea of happenings in town  ""
lots of outdoor rec opportunities  hiking  biking  snow sports  fishing  boating  ""
having farragut and round lake sp's close is great  ""
almost every restaurant in town is really good  if they aren't  they don't last  ""
we are close enough to cda and spokane to get anything needed that isn't readily available in sandpoint  ""
check out r sandpoint  ""
just be aware of the active and tolerated kkk chapter in the area     ""

drink downtown  i worked at the home depot one year up there in my 20s  and my coworkers took me drinking to all their fav spots and it was fun  i loved going up to schweitzer  i went to the fall festival up there and it was so pretty   ""

i honestly loved that town  i came from los angeles because my girl wanted to move there so badly  but we had to move to liberty lake in washington to get better jobs  i might go back there when im settling down with a family though  it was so cozy and small  ""
hope you like to snowboard or ski  i m sure people who ve lived there longer will have better ideas of what to do up there than me though  ""
the powder at schweitzer is always great  so if you are a skier or snowboarder  hit the slopes at least once there  ""
sir  schweitzer is right there  ""
mcduffs and 219  ""
head to hangtown for a haircut and shave if you re into that  ""
so many good suggestions here  thank you all for the information  i think sandpoint is going to be super awesome and i m ready for the move    ""
schweitzer can be a zoo on good powder days or winter holidays  and really expensive for on mountain food and drink  and for day tickets   ""

on the other hand  probably something like 340 days out of the year it's really chill  and if you get a season pass and use it even just on the weekends  pretty affordable on a  cost per day of skiing  pass for locals    and pretty darn affordable if you can manage to qualify for a college student discount    if you want to have something to eat or drink on the mountain without paying alterra prices  check out the st  bernard  pucci's or powderhound pizza   or  just bring your own    ""

i actually like it up there in the shoulder season  when it feels a bit like a ghost town   there's still often good hiking biking ski touring depending on the season even when the lifts aren't running   ""
mountain biking's also really good  and getting better every year around sandpoint  check out  pop  https   pendoreillepedalers org trail maps   for trail info  events and updates   ""
kaniksu land trust are a good local org working to conserve land for things like public recreation access    ""
my personal favorite local food and drink options are   ""
matchwood brewing     really good  traditional  brewpub style with live music on friday nights  and maybe other times too    ""
utara brewing     also quite good  but a bit smaller and with curries on the menu instead of traditional brewpub style food   ""
evans brothers     really good local coffee house and roasters  ""
2nd ave pizza     weird pizzas  great vibes   i admit i'm nostalgic since i've been going there and loving their weird pizzas since i was a kid 30  years ago    ""
but i'm just a guy who spends a lot of time up there  i'm sure actual locals will give you better recommendations    ""
other stuff in the region you'll want to check out   ""
priest lake   stunningly beautiful   gotten pretty popular recently  recommend campground reservations etc   ""
pend orielle   it's huge   there's tons to explore  and some great camping   ""
head to canada for a weekend   i really like rossland  nelson and fernie for a weekend in a great mountain town across the border  ""

come visit us down in moscow   a little over a 2 hour drive  i recommend a saturday in the spring or early fall when the farmer's market's on  a gameday homecoming weekend if you want crowds and a party atmosphere  or a summer weekend when school's out if you want very chill vibes  ""
this     ""
yep and speed limit is 25 in town as opposed to 35 most areas of boise at least  ""
hoot owl ""
currently my town is  uuuhh really small so sandpoint is actually a lot bigger  … ""

oh i m aware and prepared emotionally  i think   i ve definitely experienced white supremacists down where i m at  i m sure not to the degree it is up there  but after bartending for a few years i think i m pretty good at navigating that socially  i ll be curious to see how this aspect all plays out  … my big black dog will have some words for them ""
schweitzer doesn t have shit on colorado or something as far as being a  zoo  lol  a bad wait is like 10 15 minutes  ""
edited  thanks for the clarification  ""
sandpoint just got indoor tennis and an outdoor ice skating park  it has had a board park for a long time    ""

yeah   that's very true  even on a powder day on a holiday weekend  i've never waited longer than about 15 minutes in line when the lifts were running properly    ""

but the parking situation has gotten pretty rough sometimes   i'd definitely recommend taking advantage of the bus on busy days  if you're not going to be up on the mountain by o dark 30   the new base area and expanded parking will be real nice  assuming that doesn't get axed  ""
the parking situation sucks  i ve heard they re building more but nothings worse than a shuttle  ""

gonna assume you've never been there then  ""
might want to visit just saying ""

i will say that the older i get  the longer the winters seem  and i love winter  i'm a lifelong skier  but man  sometimes may rolls around  and i wake up to 5 6 inches of snow in the yard  when i was alllllmost starting to see green poke through  and i take a mental hit  ""

it s a beautiful place  but it s better to have a lucrative work from home job there  it s a vacation spot for the wealthy  lots of multi million dollars homes  high price restaurants  bars  grocery store is expensive since there are few options  if you don t do work from home  you can make a living landscaping on wealthy properties  cleaning houses  or tending to animals  a good friend of mine is a ranch hand for this guys 20 million dollar ranch in victor  he stays on the property in the care taker house  we visit often  it s wonderful  living there is rough if you re not rich  ""
do you have a trust fund  ""
i lived in the area for 2021 building houses  rent is going to be significantly higher than denver  if you re bringing a high paying remote job the locals won t like you   ""

it s a beautiful area but honestly  it wasn t worth the fight to be there  i lived in steamboat springs  colorado for a few months for work  same story there  a lot of people are looking at durango because it s not quite as throttled as the teton valley  ski towns around the country are sort of busted  no more secret ski havens   ""
not trying to be a downer but it s just reality  unfortunately  ""

consider cost of living in driggs victor  way higher than the idaho side options  i live in idaho falls  my mom and sister lives in driggs  renting would be so high  it s a really small area of town even if you consider both driggs and victor  victor closer to the teton pass  driggs closer to targhee   i prefer being an hour drive away in idaho falls myself  but not living the ski bum life anymore   there are other options like teton  ririe that have cheaper cost of living and available rentals  there is not much available in driggs victor unless you ready to pay way high prices   they vote blue right there in driggs  victor  everywhere else in idaho is very conservative and they vote red unless you are in sun valley  hailey area  which is also pretty amazing place for outdoor recreation but not as much skiing terrain as targhee area i think  hope that helps  ""
i lived in driggs from ages 3 7  my dad was a usfs employee   ""
i remember walking through the snow behind my brother because it was over my head  we picked wild berries in the fall  it s cold and beautiful  ""

i lived here for 15ish years  i still work here but moved out of the valley  you re about 5 years too late to experience the good times  it s mostly bougie second homes and wealthy transplants that have stripped the sense of community  there is a terrible suicide issue due to the economic disparity and lack of mental health care services   ""

speaking of services  they re expensive and sub par  need an oil change  plan weeks in advance  need your dryer fixed  someone might be able to get there in 30 days  the list goes on  need anything on a sunday  plan on driving to if     ""

targhee is transitioning to a destination resort and is tracked out within an hour on a powder day  the river is crazy busy all summer  transplant dog walkers will harass you while hunting public land   ""

for as nice as summers can be  and the quality of the winters at times  4 months of mud season can take its toll on people  best of luck  i remember being stoked to move to the valley  i was even more stoked to move out  ""

ms  moon starts by saying idaho is being misrepresented and then proceeds to tell us why idaho is being 100 percent accurately represented   a very far right voting electorate is electing very far right candidates  ""
by dorothy moon  idgop chairwoman ""
december 5  2024 ""

idaho stands as a proud bastion of conservatism  its politics reflecting the convictions of a state deeply rooted in republican values  yet  recent mischaracterizations of the idaho republican party as extremists by prominent media outlets and opinion writers aim to sow discord and attempt to alienate citizens at a time when unity and collective purpose are paramount  such rhetoric undermines the foundational principles of respecting the voice of the overwhelming majority   ""

opinion pieces like those published in the idaho statesman and other platforms have painted a distorted image of the idaho republican party  framing it as being led by extremist factions  headlines speak loudly terms like  far right  and  extremists  dominate editorial rhetoric  for instance  the editorial board of the idaho statesman recently asserted that  a few more extremist republicans won seats in tuesday s elections    these articles fail to acknowledge that idaho is not a  purple battleground  or a blue state leaning conservative  it is a deeply republican state where voters continue to overwhelmingly back candidates who reflect their values   ""

to dismiss the majority of state voters is disingenuous  the media s constant declaration of  extremist    far right  or  radical  labels are proof positive of the lazy  led by the nose journalists of today  their drumbeat falls short of the truth and has left them isolated within a manufactured bubble of babble inspired  rational politics   such narratives  which might align with the dynamics of liberal metro areas in other parts of the country  have no place in accurately representing idaho s political reality  ""

the people of idaho have consistently spoken through their votes  reaffirming their commitment to conservative values and principles  attempts to distort the election mandate by mischaracterizing the electorate as extreme not only insult idahoans but also erode the trust and mutual respect necessary for healthy political discourse  this state thrives on conservative bedrock values that are deeply woven into the fabric of idaho s identity  ""

contrary to media driven alarmism  the idaho republican party remains steadfast in the principles that have shaped its values for generations  dedicated to upholding the core ideals of faith  family  and freedom  the idaho gop strives to ensure that governance reflects and honors these foundational beliefs  to that end  its leadership  policies  and representatives reflect the voices and values of idahoans not the caricatures painted by out of touch commentators  ""

may   hike utah    idaho is a three way game of chicken between snowpack and smoke and fire in late july to september ""

i've been in june and it was the coldest i've ever been camping  it was a terrible night of sleep  for sure prep for winter conditions at that altitude with mild warm days full of sun  and hope you don't get hit by a storm   ""
check the forecast before the trailhead and call it off if things are potentially bad  that's the only important advice really  otherwise come prepared and don't go futher than you can get out of ""
and yes you will be camping in or amongst snow  if that wasn't obvious its probably a bad choice go in august ""
